title: Paul Atreides rides a sandworm in first trailer for Dune: Part 2
description: "In the shadows of Arrakis lie many secrets but the darkest of them all may remain."

title: Nintendo Switch accessories deals to get you ready for Tears of the Kingdom
description: Save on fun accessories before you glide into Hyrule once more.

title: “We must regulate AI,” FTC Chair Khan says
description: Khan: FTC is "well equipped" to handle AI collusion, fraud, and privacy concerns.

title: Starlink nixes plan to impose 1TB data cap and per-gigabyte overage fees
description: Home users won't have to pay extra for each gigabyte thanks to policy reversal.

title: Disease detectives gathered at CDC event—a COVID outbreak erupted
description: Some attendees reportedly did not mask, distance, or take other precautions.

title: AI vs. Hollywood: Writers battle “plagiarism machines” in union talks
description: WGA writers don't want to train AI or clean up AI-generated "sloppy first drafts."

title: Google will retire Chrome’s HTTPS padlock icon because no one knows what it means
description: Google says only 11% of users understand "the precise meaning of the lock icon."

title: Facebook furious at FTC after agency proposes ban on monetizing youth data
description: Meta has 30 days to respond to allegations about its Messenger Kids product.

title: Testosterone in tusks: Hormones in mammoth fossils excite paleontologists
description: The technique could allow us to link mammoth health and nutrition to mating.

title: Passwordless Google accounts are here—you can now switch to passkey-only
description: Switching is probably a terrible idea right now, but you've got to start somewhere.

title: Twitter just realized it was dumb to cut off automated public service tweets
description: Twitter reversed what may have been its least popular change yet under Musk.

title: Musk threatens to reassign NPR Twitter account if it won’t start tweeting again
description: Musk threat to NPR contradicts Twitter's own inactive account policy.

title: Europe’s major satellite players line up to build Starlink competitor
description: The bid includes large players such as Airbus Defence and Space, Eutelsat, and SES.

title: Caught in the act: Astronomers spot star swallowing a planet for first time
description: A sneak peek at Earth's eventual fate.

title: AMD says new Ryzen 7040 chips beat Intel (and Apple) in thin-and-light PCs
description: Ryzen 7040 brings CPU and GPU upgrades, along with AI hardware acceleration.

title: Ford boosts Mustang Mach-E range and drops price as profits grow 20%
description: The range now starts at $42,995, with price cuts of between $1,000-$4,000.

title: Thousands of unknown viruses discovered in baby poo—and that’s not bad news
description: Around 90% of viruses found in Danish diapers were bacteria killers.

title: I used System76’s Pangolin for weeks, and Linux was not the biggest problem
description: A comfy keyboard, weird trackpad, blah webcam, and notably mature Linux desktop.
